lead_paragraph: Maple Leafs forward Mark Bell was suspended for 15 games without pay by the N.H.L. after his plea last month of no contest to drunken-driving and hit-and-run charges. Bell is in Stage 2 of the league’s substance-abuse program. He was barred indefinitely Sept. 4, and the suspension will start once he is cleared to return by the program’s doctors. The players union said it would fight the suspension.
